required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physiotherapy Treatment Plan in Allergic Bronchopulmonary Aspergillosis: Case Report
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Respiratory Physiotherapy Treatment Plan in Allergic Bronchopulmonary Aspergillosis: Case Report

brief_summary.textblock: A spirometry study is performed in a patient diagnosed with allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis. An initial measurement is carried out and the patient is then put on a four-week physiotherapy treatment plan. Four spirometry measurements were taken to assess different variables and an improvement in all the spirometry values was established.

intervention.description: different values are measured on the spirometer after training in respiratory physiotherapy.

study_pop.textblock: Patient with respiratory insufficiency due to allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- woman
- diagnosis of respiratory insufficiency due to allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis
- over 50 years of age
- under 80 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- male
- not have a diagnosis of respiratory insufficiency due to allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis
- under 50 years of age
- over 80 years of age
